fields.label: translate:: Type
fields.description: translate:: Optional media to display above the question.

semantics.label: translate:: Task description
semantics.description: translate:: Describe your task here. The task description will appear above text input area.
semantics.placeholder: translate:: Summarize the book in 500 characters ...

semantics.label: translate:: Help text
semantics.description: translate:: This text should help the user to get started.

semantics.label: translate:: Sample solution
semantics.description: translate:: You can optionally add a sample solution that's shown after the student created a text. It's called sample solution because there probably is not only one solution

fields.label: translate:: Introduction
fields.description: translate:: You can optionally leave the students some explanations about your example. The explanations will only show up if you add an example, too.
fields.placeholder: translate:: Please remember that you were not expected to come up with the exact same solution. It's just a good example.

fields.label: translate:: Sample solution text
fields.description: translate:: The student will see a "Show solution" button after submitting if you provide some text here.

fields.label: translate:: Keyword
fields.description: translate:: Keyword or phrase to look for. Use an asterisk '*' as a wildcard for one or more characters. Use a slash '/' at the beginning and the end to use a regular expression.

fields.label: translate:: Variations
fields.description: translate:: Add optional variations for this keyword. Example: For a 'city' add alternatives 'town', 'municipality' etc. Points will be awarded if the user includes any of the specified alternatives.

fields.label: translate:: Points
fields.description: translate:: Points that the user will get if he/she includes this keyword or its alternatives in the answer.

fields.label: translate:: Occurrences
fields.description: translate:: Define how many occurrences of the keyword or its variations should be awarded with points.

fields.label: translate:: Case sensitive
fields.description: translate:: Makes sure the user input has to be exactly the same as the answer.

fields.label: translate:: Forgive minor mistakes
fields.description: translate:: This will accept minor spelling mistakes (3-9 characters: 1 mistake, more than 9 characters: 2 mistakes).

fields.label: translate:: Feedback if keyword included
fields.description: translate:: This feedback will be displayed if the user includes this keyword or its alternatives in the answer.

fields.label: translate:: Feedback if keyword missing
fields.description: translate:: This feedback will be displayed if the user doesnâ€™t include this keyword or its alternatives in the answer.

fields.label: translate:: Feedback word shown if keyword included
fields.description: translate:: This option allows you to specify which word should be shown in front of your feedback if a keyword was found in the text.

fields.label: translate:: Feedback word shown if keyword missing
fields.description: translate:: This option allows you to specify which word should be shown in front of your feedback if a keyword was not found in the text.

fields.label: translate:: Define custom feedback for any score range
fields.description: translate:: Click the "Add range" button to add as many ranges as you need. Example: 0-20% Bad score, 21-91% Average Score, 91-100% Great Score!

fields.label: translate:: Feedback for defined score range

semantics.label: translate:: Behavioural settings
semantics.description: translate:: These options will let you control how the task behaves.

fields.label: translate:: Minimum number of characters
fields.description: translate:: Specify the minimum number of characters that the user must enter.

fields.label: translate:: Maximum number of characters
fields.description: translate:: Specify the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

fields.label: translate:: Input field size
fields.description: translate:: The size of the input field in amount of lines it will cover

fields.label: translate:: Enable "Retry"
fields.description: translate:: If checked, learners can retry the task.

fields.label: translate:: Ignore scoring
fields.description: translate:: If checked, learners will only see the feedback that you provided for the keywords, but no score.

fields.label: translate:: Points in host environment
fields.description: translate:: Used to award points in host environment merely for answering (not shown to learner).

fields.label: translate:: Passing percentage
fields.description: translate:: Percentage that's necessary for passing

fields.label: translate:: Mastering percentage
fields.description: translate:: Percentage that's necessary for mastering. Setting the mastering percentage below 100 % will lower the maximum possible score accordingly. It's intended to give some leeway to students, not to "graciously accept" solutions that do not contain all keywords.

fields.label: translate:: Override case sensitive
fields.description: translate:: This option determines if the "Case sensitive" option will be activated for all keywords.

fields.label: translate:: Override forgive mistakes
fields.description: translate:: This option determines if the "Forgive mistakes" option will be activated for all keywords.

semantics.label: translate:: Header for panel containing feedback for included/missing keywords
translate:: Remaining characters
semantics.description: translate:: Message for remaining characters. You can use @chars which will be replaced by the corresponding number.

semantics.label: translate:: Not enough characters
semantics.default: translate:: You must enter at least @chars characters!
semantics.description: translate:: Message to indicate that the text doesn't contain enough characters. You can use @chars which will be replaced by the corresponding number.

semantics.label: translate:: Save message
semantics.description: translate:: Message indicating that the text has been saved

semantics.label: translate:: Your result (not displayed)
semantics.description: translate:: Accessibility text used for readspeakers. @score will be replaced by the number of points. @total will be replaced by the maximum possible points.
semantics.default: translate:: You got @score out of @total points

semantics.label: translate:: Navigation message (not displayed)
semantics.description: translate:: Accessibility text used for readspeakers
semantics.default: translate:: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.
